content.text:
# Draft:Barwar ( Kshatriya clan )

Barwar Kshatriya  Rajput dynasty is from northern India which is a branch of the ancient Bais clan His two ancestors,They ruled over the Amsin pargana of Ayodhya from 16th century to 1857. His two ancestors were Bariyaar Singh and Chahu Singh, both sons of King Chatrasen and seventh descendants of King Trilokchand Bais, who were descendants of the Daundiya Khera state of Unnao district, In the year 1570, both the brothers were fought against Akbar and both were imprisoned. In 1585, he somehow escaped from prison and established a kingdom by attacking Amsin Pargana of Ayodhya district. This kingdom was named Barwar after Bariyar Singh. Since then Bariyar Singh is also called Barwar Singh. Later his descendants were called Barwar, who still reside in Ayodhya, Gonda and surrounding areas.
